intro: Teucrium capitatum subvar. caespitulosum, commonly known as the clustered germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features compact,丛生 (clumped) growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
